If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27813](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27813) (guix: Update `python-lief` package to 0.13.1 by hebasto)
* [#27811](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27811) (guix: Clean up manifest by hebasto)
* [#27099](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27099) (build: produce a .zip for macOS distribution by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully -static-pie x86_64 bitcoind using GCC and glibc by fanquake)
* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (build: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux (Guix) by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (build: LLVM 15 & LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Concept ACK.

I'm having trouble finding where ppc64 became unsupported in guix though. There were lots of refactors and I'm guessing some wildcard change is maybe responsible? I'd like to understand why it was disabled just in case it was accidental. In that case, we'd want to upstream a fix I think?
